headline.main: Removing Hemorrhoids In Painless Office Visit

docs.lead_paragraph: More and more doctors are using a quick, painless way to eradicate hemorrhoids using mild electrical currents. The procedure is carried out in a doctor's office and patients go back to work immediately after treatment. Two such techniques, one using direct current and the other alternating current, have been around for about five years but relatively few patients and physicians are familiar with them, said Dr. Daniel A. Norman, division chief of gastroenterology at Barton Memorial Hospital in South Lake Tahoe, Calif., who developed the direct current system.
